climbs.name: Steph Abegg Memorial Route aka Tangent Traverse

content.description:
Start inside the rock, on the shelf, and then traverse out either left or right, clockwise or counter clockwise. Either way, the difficulties are about the same, but the crux may be different.

The top is off. For full points you have to top out before returning to the shelf. Then once on top, lower yourself back into the shelf.

A description of the piece on the WWU web site reads, "Sitting like a sentinel, the work references geological and cultural epochs." Steph Abegg's time at WWU and climbing in the surrounding areas was certainly an important epoch in PNW climbing history. Thank you Steph!
content.location: Big hunk o granite south of the Biology building

content.description: Feet on one wall, hands on the other... push hard
content.protection: Couple of stitches after you face plant onto the gravel below
content.location: Walk towards south campus while pondering the reasons you pour thousands of dollars into this institution. Look to your left and climb the obvious gaping chimney

content.description:
Pitch 1: Climb the proud northernmost arete on the formation via fantastic square holds on gray patina.  Upon gaining the large ledge head southeast.

Pitch 2:  Climb the right side of the second obvious arete on unique perfectly clear and square rock with small green edges.  Gain another large ledge and trek south and slightly east.

Pitch 3: Ascend the gully on ladder-like holds to the broad summit plateau.

Descent:  Downclimb the route.
content.protection: Dark hoody and a spotter are recommended.  Best done at night.

content.description: Ascend the south facing stem box. Dries quickly after a dreary drizzle. In order to receive 'all the marbles' contestants much gain the true summit.
content.protection: A steady head and an absent shaky leg.

climbs.name: Imagine Your Worst Student Here
climbs.fa: Nick Lyon, Daniel Hassell, Matthew Tangeman, Levi Hamernick 2016

content.description: Start with crimping in between the left and right window. Don't kick the window, or you may alert the authorities. Reach up and crimp an improbably placed plaque, match, and make a committing move for the top and mantle. More climbing to the top of the building seemed possible, but some choss may ensue. Use caution.
content.protection: The protection of the night and the spirit of Harambe.
content.location: PAC - sneak behind the brick wall facing the library, into a courtyard with some trees. Locate a metal plaque near the top of the building, above the arched windows. Start directly beneath on the window sill.

content.description: traverse the quarter to half inch edges, passing windows with no hands rests, and continuing around small corners.
content.location: East face of the Communications building
On the north west flank of Academic West.

content.protection: pretty strait forward single rack & brush (there's mortar in most of the placements)
